_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The five emotional shackles [an9.72:3.7]: Greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures
Eating as much as they like until their belly is full, then indulging in the pleasures of sleeping, lying down, and drowsing
Leading the spiritual life wishing to be reborn in one of the orders of gods
The four kinds of mindfulness meditation: Meditating by observing an aspect of the body
Meditating observing an aspect of feelings
Meditating observing an aspect of the mind
Meditating observing an aspect of principles
